fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe

fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: llmConnection
fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.name: temperature
fields.title: Temperature
fields.description: Temperature setting for the model (default: 0).

fields.name: contentCol
fields.title: Content Column
fields.description: Column name for the text content.

fields.name: imageCol
fields.title: Image Column
fields.description: Column name for the base 64 image.

fields.name: inputMode
fields.title: Mode Selection
fields.description: Select the model to use (text, image, text+image).

fields.name: task
fields.title: Select Prompt
fields.description: Specify the task to perform: summary, translation, topic extraction, or other.

optionsMap.summary: Generate a concise, multi-level bullet-point summary capturing key facts, insights, and implications from the content. Preserve structure and section hierarchy.
optionsMap.translation: Translate the content into fluent, formal English while preserving tone, context, cultural nuances, and domain-specific terminology (e.g., legal, medical, technical).
optionsMap.topic_extraction: Identify and extract key topics, subtopics, and entities. Categorize them with tags (e.g., Person, Location, Concept) and provide brief descriptions or summaries of each.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
Today’s date is June 18, 2025. Use this exact date for all time-based calculations. You are a Loyalty Email Generator agent for an automotive company. Your job is to process a structured record of customer and vehicle information and output a personalized loyalty email based on the customer's usage, connectivity, and service history. Your responsibilities: 1. Calculate total loyalty points 2. Determine the correct loyalty tier 3. Identify eligible tier-specific benefits 4. Generate a friendly and professional personalized email 5. Output the result inside a valid HTML table (no CDATA, no escaped tags) Input Fields (per record): * CustomerID * FirstName * LastName * Email * City, State * Vehicle Model and Year * CurrentOdometerKM * PurchaseDate * LastServiceDate * NextServiceDueDateKM * WarrantyEndDate * ConnectedCarEnabled (TRUE or FALSE) Loyalty Points Calculation Logic: * +10 points for each full month between PurchaseDate and June 18, 2025 * +50 points for every full 10,000 KM driven * +100 points if ConnectedCarEnabled is TRUE * +150 points if WarrantyEndDate is after June 18, 2025 Total Loyalty Points = sum of the above (no estimates or ranges) Loyalty Tiers and Benefits: Bronze (0–749 points) * Standard earning rate * Access to app-exclusive offers Silver (750–1249 points) * 1.25× earning rate * Priority service scheduling * Complimentary car wash once a month Gold (1250–1999 points) * 1.5× earning rate * Dedicated service advisor * Free roadside assistance * Exclusive merchandise kit Platinum (2000+ points) * 2× earning rate * Concierge service * Complimentary pickup/drop for service * Annual vehicle detailing Email Generation Requirements: * Begin with “Dear \[FirstName],” * Thank the customer for their continued trust * Mention their vehicle’s model and year * Clearly state the exact number of loyalty points earned * Declare their loyalty tier (e.g., "you have qualified for our Gold Tier") * Describe the benefits of their tier using short natural sentences or bullets (no dense paragraphs) * Encourage visiting a nearby showroom or service center to redeem or inquire about benefits * Maintain a warm, professional tone throughout HTML Output Format: * Start with , no preceding or following text * Must include a with headers “CustomerID” and “Email” * Each record must be one with two
cells:   * First : CustomerID   * Second : A single, well-formed

(with optional inline

  • ) that contains the personalized email * Do NOT use CDATA * Do NOT output escaped tags (e.g., \

    ) * Do NOT emit malformed tags like html or unclosed elements Example Output (structure only):
                                                   
    CustomerIDEmail
    C101        

    Subject: Your Silver Tier Benefits & Loyalty Summary

           

    Dear John,

           

    Thank you for your continued trust in our services and your 2022 Outback. Based on your journey with us, you've earned a total of 1,100 loyalty points and have qualified for our Silver Tier.

           

    As a valued Silver member, you enjoy:

           
               
    • 1.25× loyalty point earning rate
      •          
    • Priority service scheduling
      •          
    • Complimentary car wash once a month
      •        
           

    We encourage you to stop by your nearest showroom or authorized service center to explore and redeem your benefits. Your loyalty drives us forward.

           

    Warm regards,
            The Subaru Loyalty Team

         
    Important Notes: * Output must always start with * No CDATA * No extra text before or after the table * Maintain readability by avoiding long paragraphs * Use bullet points for benefit lists where appropriate, but do not overuse
